definitions.definition: A tool for finding whether a surface is level, or for creating a horizontal or vertical line of reference.
definitions.example: Hand me the level so I can tell if this is correctly installed.

definitions.definition: A distance relative to a given reference elevation.
definitions.example: By the end of the day, we'd dug down to the level of the old basement floor.

definitions.definition: Degree or amount.
definitions.example: The sound level is much too high; this hurts my ears.   We've reached a new level of success.

definitions.definition: Achievement or qualification.
definitions.example: She achieved a high level of distinction.

definitions.definition: Distance from the root node of a tree structure.
One of several discrete segments of a game, generally increasing in difficulty and representing different locations in the game world.
definitions.example: It took me weeks to get to level seven.   Watch out for the next level; the bad guys there are really overpowered.

definitions.definition: A numeric value that quantifies a character's experience and power.
definitions.example: My half-orc barbarian reached fifth level before he was squashed by a troll.

definitions.definition: A floor of a multi-storey building.
definitions.example: Take the elevator and get off at the promenade level.

definitions.definition: An area of almost perfectly flat land.
A school grade or year.
To adjust so as to make as flat or perpendicular to the ground as possible.
definitions.example: You can level the table by turning the pads that screw into the feet.

definitions.definition: To destroy by reducing to ground level; to raze.
definitions.example: The hurricane leveled the forest.

definitions.definition: To progress to the next level.
definitions.example: I levelled after defeating the dragon.

definitions.definition: To aim or direct (a weapon, a stare, an accusation, etc).
definitions.example: He levelled an accusation of fraud at the directors.  The hunter levels the gun before taking a shot.

definitions.definition: To direct or impose (a penalty, fine, etc) at or upon (someone).
To make the score of a game equal.
To bring to a common level or plane, in respect of rank, condition, character, privilege, etc.
definitions.example: to level all the ranks and conditions of men

definitions.definition: To adjust or adapt to a certain level.
definitions.example: to level remarks to the capacity of children

definitions.definition: (usually with "with") To speak honestly and openly with.
The same height at all places; parallel to a flat ground.
definitions.example: This table isn't quite level; see how this marble rolls off it?

definitions.definition: At the same height as some reference; constructed as level with.
definitions.example: We tried to hang the pictures so that the bottom of the frames were level with the dark line in the wallpaper.

definitions.definition: Unvaried in frequency.
definitions.example: His pulse has been level for 12 hours.

definitions.definition: Unvaried in volume.
definitions.example: His voice has been unchanged. It has been level for 12 hours.

definitions.definition: Calm.
definitions.example: He kept a level gaze.

definitions.definition: In the same position or rank.
Straightforward; direct; clear.
Well balanced; even; just; steady; impartial.
definitions.example: a level head; a level understanding

definitions.definition: Of even tone; without rising or falling inflection; monotonic.
Perpendicular to a gravitational force.
definitions.example: The earth's oceans remain level in relation to the pull of gravity.
